paper_abstract: This paper provides an overview of a rover guidance, navigation, and control (GN&C) architecture being developed to support a ground-ice prospecting mission to Mars. The main contribution of this paper is to detail an integrated field campaign that demonstrates the viability of the key rover GN&C techniques needed to carry out this mission. Tests were conducted on Devon Island in the Canadian High Arctic during the summer of 2009, wherein a large field robot was driven on real polygonal terrain (a landform of interest on Mars). Lessons learned and recommendations for future work are provided. (C) 2011 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Field testing of a rover guidance, navigation, and control architecture to support a ground-ice prospecting mission to Mars
